intro: Sphacele gaudichaudii, commonly known as the Gaudichaud's sphacele, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
